title: Capturing the Essence of Street Life through Lense

author.name: Maxin Dalton
author.bio: Photographer and writer with a passion for urban stories.

content.text: Street photography is more than just taking pictures of people in public. It's about capturing a moment, a look, or an interaction.

It requires patience, observation, and a quick eye for composition. The best street photographs are those that reveal the extraordinary in the ordinary. A shaft of light hitting a building, a fleeting expression on a stranger's face, the juxtaposition of old and new.

Henri Cartier-Bresson coined the term 'the decisive moment' to describe that split second when all the elements of a scene come together perfectly. In street photography, missing that moment means missing the shot forever.
